1: Despite their best efforts, the Champion Light and his companions were defeated by the Lord of Shadow. Whisked away and transformed into a small rabbit-like creature by a mysterious power, Light soon met Alk and Stella in Starview Village, an observatory of worlds. While still grappling with this new knowledge, Stella established a connection with a world outside Starview Village, allowing the three of them to set out for adventure.
Home to the ruling Stratos royal family in Light's world. The stark white castle overlooking the capital Excelion is said to leave quite the impression on visitors.

One of the Kingdom of Stratos' legendary heroes, tasked with defeating the Lord of Shadow. Accompanied by a cleric and mage, he stormed the Tower of the Dark Throne and even managed to corner the dark lord. However, at the last second, the Lord of Shadow was able to curse the Champion, turning him into a weak, rabbit-like creature.
2: According to Lilith, below Castle Excelion exists the Oracle's Hall, where the birth of new Champions is signaled. However, no such sign was given by the Hall for Light's birth, so at the time, Light and Shakari were tasked with trials to prove themselves, much to Shakari's chagrin.
3:
"Spirits, I beseech you! Harness the light that dwells within—let it become flame!"

With the Mark of Rustamov and his little remaining power, the Champion Light's wish allowed him to resume his true form for a short time. However, as his actions went against the Stars, his power as Champion has been taken away from him for good. Light, however, has no regrets.

1: The king of the fiends and invader of Light's world. Seemingly defeated by the Champion, he managed to muster just enough strength to curse Light, turning him into a beast.

Home to the Lord of Shadow, this fortress features a large tower surrounded by a number of smaller ones. Surrounded on all four sides by inhospitable terrain, the inside of the tower is also crawling with Fiends and their ilk. An ominous and impenetrable lair overflowing with miasma.

A device that allows for transport between worlds. Starview Village's World Flipper was previously disabled, although Alk did attempt to activate it ninety-seven times. It was finally reactivated with the arrival of Light, allowing Alk, Stella, and Light access to other worlds.
2: Coordinates are necessary to travel using the World Flipper. Traveling to a region without specific coordinates sends the user to a random location and world. Upon receiving coordinates and linking World Flippers, travel between the two devices should be secure, but occasional misfires may still happen.
3: Many World Flippers are found in locations that are hidden away from prying eyes. A few worlds even refer to these places as Oracle's Halls.
4: An important device managed by the Goddess of the Stars Stella, the use of which has been restricted by the Overlords. In the past, the device was used to deliver decrees to each world. While historic evidence of movement between worlds is slim, there are signs of a large migration of people into Palpebra.

1: The Keeper of Starview Village and the World Flipper, who suffers from amnesia. The only thing she remembers is that she must watch over the stars and await the Champion. A clumsy girl who tends to think before she acts.
2: Upon retrieving coordinates, Light and Stella were met with a vision of the Champion Lux visiting Starview Village. In that vision, he refers to the one residing there as the Oracle, strengthening the theory that Stella is the legendary Oracle of Champions.
3:
Observer. Arbiter. Purger. These were the duties assigned to the goddess Stella, who carried out these orders flawlessly.

However, as more worlds and more Champions met their ends, the goddess came to know what pain is. One day, she turned the lance upon herself, resulting in the birth of the two Stellas.

1: An observatory where the various worlds float in the sky like stars. Until Alk arrived, Stella was the only resident. The red fruit seen throughout the town is edible but incredibly sour on its own.

Familiars of the fiends and followers of the Lord of Shadow. Horns, wings, and glowing red eyes are common characteristics of these creatures. Normally guarding the Tower of the Dark Throne, one of them also followed after the escaped Champion, attacking Starview Village.
2:
Daemons are born when black magic is used to warp a human or fiend's form, although daemons created from humans lack wings.

As Ilbis was able to transform into a powerful daemon after he was presumed dead, it can be assumed that daemons share the same immortality as the Lord of Shadow.
3: The curse used to transform one into a daemon is fueled by the resentment of the dead. Greatly feared by the fiends, it was often used as punishment for the criminals in their world. In order to become a daemon, the victim must resonate with the curse, so while rare, it is possible for the curse to fail to transform its victim.

1: Light's title, given to those who command the powers of light in their quest to destroy evil. On Light's world, these legendary heroes have existed since time immemorial, with multiple examples recorded throughout history.
A friend of Light who accompanied him when he stormed the Tower of the Dark Throne.
A magic-wielding girl from the same hometown as Light. She is particularly skilled at fire magic.
The ruler of Light's world. He is the one who tasked Light with defeating the Lord of Shadow.
The daughter of the King of Stratos, Princess Lily. She and Light appear to have been close.

When Light lost his powers as Champion he was cursed with the form of a small, rabbit-like creature. While he may be weak, he is still a proud hero determined to destroy the Lord of Shadow. In order to reach his goal, he travels with Alk and Stella, hoping to find his home world.
アナタヲカンゲイシマス
Whenever someone is entrusted with knowledge of Starview Village, Stella is the first to welcome them. Once welcomed, there is no going back.
A world where the forest stretches as far as the eye can see. Upon arrival, Alk and the others began their search for the World Flipper, hoping to find the coordinates to Light's world.
2:
At the center of the forest lies the Spirit Tree, which towers magnificently over the landscape. Among the greenery lives a plethora of sprites and monsters, but not a single living human.

After returning the corrupted Regitare to normal, Alk, Stella, and Light activated the World Flipper and moved on to the next world.

1: A technique used by Alk. Modeled after the light that swooped down upon Starview Village, it involves leaping into the air and descending upon your foes. So basically a very high jump.
2:
A destructive technique used by the Lord of Shadow that summons a slew of stars and sends them hurtling to the earth, annihilating everything in their path.

"Stars above, turn your cold countenances upon the creatures below, who beg scraps of your heavenly light. Know the weight of their wishes. Know the gravity of your failures. Know, that you shall fall!"
3: The Purger Lux ravaged the stars and slew entire worlds. Having absorbed the power of six dragons, the meteor storms he summoned were capable of devastating entire planets.
4:
Meteor Break Rising
A technique used by Alk. After descending upon his opponent, he raises his sword once more. So basically a jump followed by a slash.

1: The oldest and largest tree within the Garden of the Sprites, created by Regitare. Its branches seem to support the very heavens, and its roots extend deep into the soil. The trunk of the tree harbors a plethora of living organisms, while the leaves seem to radiate life with their vibrant green color—a precious existence brimming with life.

Information known to Stella. Each world belongs to one of seven regions, and the coordinates of a world specify where in that region a world resides. Countless worlds exist in each system, but by establishing the coordinates for each region, Stella was able to check each domain for Light's world.

The legendary tales on Light's world often include this mysterious figure, said to be a guide to the Champions.
However, records about this person are sparse, so even Light doubted their existence.

The various worlds Alk and co. travel to are divided into seven regions. The number of worlds within even one region is immeasurable.

The Garden of the Sprites is located in the same region as Palpebra.
Shroombo from the Garden of the Sprites communicate using a rudimentary language.

The name of the town that houses the Kaleidoscope at its center.

As the town was formed by adventurers and merchants seeking their fortunes in the Kaleidoscope, Palpebra does not have a monarchy. It is instead governed by a merchant group called the Adventurer's Guild, or the Guild for short.
2: The population of Palpebra consists mainly of Land Walkers, people whose appearance resembles humans from other worlds, Sheephirds, a nomadic group with child-like appearances, and the furred Gargans. In addition to these groups, beastfolk and drifters from other worlds also call this sprawling town home.
3:
Fifty years ago, before the Kaleidoscope was discovered, the land where Palpebra now stands was barren and only visited by certain nomadic groups. However, since the mysterious labyrinth's discovery, the sudden rise in population and technological improvements have transformed Palpebra into a force that neighboring regions could no longer ignore.

However, behind the media magazines and bustling food industry, Palpebra has its own problems, such as wealth inequality and the countless orphans left behind by lost adventurers.
4:
While the tools and technology retrieved from the Kaleidoscope have had a huge impact on Palpebra's development, by far the largest contributor was the discovery that elements can be used for agriculture.

Thirty years prior, the Farlands Princess Etheria Nialas traveled to Palpebra, hoping to strengthen ties with the city and possibly make use of this new technology. However, during her visit, she was attacked and killed, leading to the tense hostility between the two regions.

1:
A strange labyrinth that appeared fifty years ago. Its layout is constantly changing in what are called "shifts."
These shifts are a strange phenomenon that briefly connect to other worlds, causing items from these worlds to be found in the Kaleidoscope. Particularly dangerous items are called cryptic artifacts, which are closely monitored by the Guild Knights and Voluntas Academy.
2: Adventurers caught up in shifts are sent to other worlds, but the shifts have also been known to send people from other worlds to Palpebra. These people are known as drifters.
3:
The Kaleidoscope is divided into three sections: the shallows, the midways, and the depths.

The shallows are smaller in scale, and its shifts and the time between them are well-documented, making them fairly safe, but the lower two levels are far more treacherous. Just being able to return from the depths is enough to get oneself in the history books.
4: Occasionally, adventurers will come across a mysterious figured known as the Dark Mage of the Kaleidoscope. Reports of him date back to when the Kaleidoscope was first discovered, but sightings have increased significantly in recent years.

1: A term used for the visitors from other worlds. Strangely enough, the same term is used in both Palpebra and the Endless Blue.

The merchant organization that governs Palpebra, and the first stop for any drifters who wish to establish themselves as adventurers. Also known simply as the Guild.

Their headquarters also has a tavern, allowing for a lively atmosphere. Adventurers take quests from the bulletin board and Guild workers will evaluate whether the adventurer is skilled enough for that particular quest. Quests range from exploring the Kaleidoscope and collecting materials to simple business negotiations.
2: In addition to managing payments, contracts, and negotiations, the Guild also provides training programs for new adventurers and other forms of support. They also perform routine inspections to ensure no adventurers are running afoul of the law. Another of their duties is to check the aptitude of their members. Adventurers who receive good marks will receive harder Kaleidoscope quests.
3: The Guild is very strict in its management of the items coming from the Kaleidoscope. In order to avoid the processing fee required by the Guild for the handling and sale of Kaleidoscope artifacts, some adventurers have resorted to smuggling. The Guild is currently working to crack down on such cases.
4:
The Guild handles emergency protocol for the city in times of danger. The Guild Knights, operated by the Guild, also work to maintain peace in the city on a regular basis.

With their activities ranging from planning citywide events to managing orphanages, the Guild is more akin to a governing body than a merchant's organization.

1:
A cheerful sheephird girl with a proactive attitude towards work. One of Alk and co.'s trusted allies.

Her official title is Manager of the Palpebra Guild Headquarters: Adventurer Safety, Advertising, and General Quality of Life Division.
A sheephird merchant. While she used to operate mainly in Palpebra, upon learning of Starview Village, she began crossing worlds to both sell her wares and obtain new ones.

The elemental energy that fills the world can sometimes be found in gem form, called elemental gems. These gems, just like the elements, are divided into six types: fire, water, wind, thunder, light, and dark.

Their form and function vary slightly depending on the world, but many worlds use them as an energy source.
2:
In Palpebra, in addition to being used by mages as catalysts for their magic, elemental gems are also used in large quantities as fertilizer, allowing for larger harvests.

Alchemists in the Endless Blue use these gems in their experiments as an energy source.
3:
Elemental gems have similar uses regardless of world, but the name and usage of the powers within those gems differ depending on the world and culture—so much so that certain systems seem to contradict others.

Most notably, the diviners of Yamato do not believe in a six-element system.

1: A long-lived race that resides in the Silver Woods. Their long, pointed ears, beauty, and proficiency in magic are all characteristics of their people. Sometimes called the fair folk of the woods.
2:
In the Home of the Champions, elves were long thought to be works of fiction, found only in fairy tales.

However, in recent times, the elf world has merged with the Champion's, perhaps meaning that they were originally closely connected to begin with. It is now theorized that the elves in fairy tales were drifters from this other world.

1:
Workers who make a living carrying out quests from the Adventurer's Guild. Anyone can be an adventurer, regardless of age, gender, or place of origin.

Many adventurers form parties, but some work solo as well. There are also cases where adventurers join parties temporarily.

Most adventurers make their living by exploring the Kaleidoscope and bringing back elemental gems or artifacts. Others focus on more general tasks, like helping villagers or the Guild itself.

A desert world where the sun beats down relentlessly and the sands stretch as far as the eye can see.

Dropped into this harsh environment, Alk, Light, and Stella quickly began to search for signs of life.
2:
The kingdom ruling this desolate land has flourished under a class system they themselves enforce.

While the ruins littering the desert tell of an advanced civilization, more than a thousand years have passed since, and the kingdom is currently headed towards ruin.

With nowhere left to go, Nimbus was invited to join Alk and the others on their adventures. The four then set off for the next world.

1: A monarchy rules the Kingdom of Sand. The royal lineage goes back to ancient times, and it is under their command that the lords are dispatched to each region. Forced hard labor is common in this land, giving the kingdom a tyrannical reputation and leading certain groups in the borderlands to begin rebelling.
A young lord in charge of a region near the borderlands. While working on a treaty with the borderlands, he was assassinated by a retainer, who took his place as Lord of the Oasis.
2: After discovering the Hellcat of the Dunes being paraded around at a freak show, Rolan rescued the beastfolk and named him Nimbus due to his white and fluffy fur, resembling a cloud. As time went on, the two grew to be close friends.
3:
Fearing a conflict between the kingdom and the borderlands, Rolan used whatever means necessary to avert such a disaster.

He would often tell Nimbus tales of other worlds and how he wished to see them, but once he discovered the World Flipper in the nearby ruins, he concealed its location, fearing the royal family would abuse its power.

1: The current lord of the region near the borderlands. A former vassal of the previous lord Rolan, this new lord assumed his duties after Rolan's assassination. In order to avenge his predecessor, the Lord of the Oasis sent out young children to kill the Hellcat of the Dunes.
2: The true culprit behind Rolan's death, however, was him. Normally, control of the golems is transferred to a person by the royal family or someone trusted by them. The Lord of the Oasis claimed he received this power from Rolan, but in reality, it is likely the Masked Sorceress gave him this power.
4: While it appeared as though the Masked Sorceress killed him, he was actually confined to Pandemonium. While there, he was transformed into the Spiteful Aberration by Ilbis.

1: A mysterious figure who approached the former Lord of the Oasis' killer and gave him the power he needed. In addition to knowing how the golems work, she also knew Light's identity as Champion and seems to know Stella as well. However, she disappeared before she could be questioned further.
2:
After she summoned Yamato no Orochi and attempted to shallow the world in darkness, her mask fell away, revealing the same face as Stella.

"In the infinite night, we shall share one infinite dream!"

1: A young boy charged with taking down the Hellcat of the Dunes by the Lord of the Oasis. The lord held his brothers and sisters as hostages. He tried to bury Alk and the others in the ruins with him, but Nimbus, the Hellcat himself, saved his life.
サバクノキョウジュウ
Nickname given to Nimbus in the Kingdom of Sand by a freak show hoping to make a spectacle of him.
Despite their animal-like appearances, this race is capable of speech. Some beastfolk have more limited bestial features, such as only ears or a tail.

A world where the waves stretch as far as the eye can see, and all that remains of society sleeps beneath the murky depths.

When Alk and the others found themselves on a ship floating in this endless ocean, they were mistaken for stowaways, leading to a fight with the pirates on board.
2:
While there was once a vast continent with an advanced civilization in this world, the majority of the land became submerged as the sea levels rose for an unknown reason. Nowadays, people live on communities called floats, made by stringing boats together.

Thanks to the pirate captain Marina and the mermaid Amelia, Alk and the others managed to find the World Flipper and headed to the next world.
3:
Floats are at the mercy of the elements and monsters that populate the ocean. The most dangerous of these threats is the Devourer of Stars, a mysterious existence looming over the Endless Blue.

Many floats have become uninhabitable, but the government appears to be dodging responsibility and questions about the incidents. To date, no solution has been proposed.

1:
The pirate crew led by Captain Marina. Their name derives from their astonishing luck. No matter how crimson their blades become, they always come out on top.

Despite being lawless pirates, the Crimson Blades are known for protecting merchant ships and other good deeds, making them popular among the commonfolk.
2:
Five years ago, the great pirate Zegra disappeared without a trace. When Marina first drifted into the Endless Blue, it was Zegra who saved her, and she even worked with him for a time.

However, their personalities and ideologies clashed, eventually leading to the two splitting ways. Many of the core Crimson Blade crew members left with her.
3: The Crimson Blades hold a lot of influence over the Endless Blue. Since Marina left to join Alk and the others on their adventures, a number of pirate crews have started making trouble, leading to a shift in the balance of power.
4: The Gaean Navy has desperately been searching for the Crimson Blades' whereabouts, but to no avail.

1:
The government that rules the little remaining land in the Endless Blue. At one time quite powerful, their influence has waned as their shores continue to be consumed by the ocean.

While they do possess a military in the form of the Gaean Navy, they have very little control over the seas, leading the people to regard them as untrustworthy.
2: Many of the Gaean government's higher-ups seem to be more concerned with themselves than their constituents. This could be due to the fact that, despite their promise, no one has been able to figure out why the sea levels are rising or how they can reverse it.

1: Anyone who wants to see the light-hearted Alk get serious need only head to the kitchen. Alk's home cooking is highly regarded among those in Starview Village, with some residents choosing to move in just to have access to it.
2:
Signature Dish #1: Red Soup
A simmered soup made by frying chicken, pumpkin, carrots, onions, red bell peppers, and mushrooms from the Garden of the Sprites in ginger, garlic, and olive oil before adding crushed tomatoes.

Alk claims the soup base does all the work, but he's the one who made that base with spices he procured in Palpebra himself.
3:
Signature Dish #2: Minced Meat Omelet
Omelet with a filling made from a small amount of reconstituted dried shiitake mushrooms and equal parts ground meat and minced onion, fried in salt and pepper.

The trick to creating the perfect omelet is to scramble the eggs quickly over the heat. Adding a teaspoon of sugar and a little milk to the egg mixture will make the flavor more kid-friendly. Adding cheese is another great addition.

1: A large, squid-like creature found in the Endless Blue. They are known to attack ships and hoard treasure in their nests.

A large, hermit crab-like creature found in the Endless Blue. Despite its fearsome appearance, Amelia is actually quite close to the creature, calling it "Hermie." It seems the Masked Sorceress manipulated the creature into invading the merfolk's sacred grounds.

Floating towns created by linking multiple vessels together.

As the sea levels continued to rise, denizens of the Endless Blue began living on the waves, free from the restrictions of the Gaean government.

As a float can be created anywhere by anyone, the Gaean government has a difficult time properly regulating and patrolling them, leaving some completely outside the law.

A race of half-fish, half-humanoid people that protects the ruins which house the World Flipper. They also possess the power to grant humans the ability to breath underwater.

Some believe that the flesh of a mermaid will grant immortality, resulting in poachers hunting them down.
2:
The merfolk were originally humans who modified their genetics to suit life underwater.

While science was certainly part of the modifications, some believe another mysterious, psycho-kinetic power was also at play.

1: A merfolk elder who guards the ruins on the ocean floor. When he fist met Alk and the others, he mistook them for enemies. Upon learning that they saved Amelia's life, he begrudgingly aided their search for the World Flipper. He has a bad back.
2: Being Amelia's grandfather, he has his hands full dealing with her constant disappearances and negligence towards her studies. He does deeply care for her though, as shown by how worried he was when she was captured by humans or headed to the Northern Seas.

1: The captain of a rival pirate crew whose hate for the Crimson Blades and Marina knows no bounds.

The northern region of the Endless Blue, where countless ships have disappeared. This region also houses the World Flipper. Going even farther north will lead to the area where the creature known as the Devourer of Stars is said to sleep.

Workers who make a living searching the sunken cities for hidden treasure. As any salvage found in the ruins belong to the Gaean government, salvaging is technically illegal, but most denizens of the Endless Blue ignore this.

As salvage jobs require diving for long periods of time, special diving equipment or underwater transportation is necessary.

Wildlands characterized by arid soil and strong winds.

Soon after arriving, Nimbus detected the strangely familiar scent of beastfolk, so Alk and the others decided to proceed with caution.
2:
A world completely populated by beastfolk and presumably Nimbus' home world. Aside from the catfolk and dogfolk, many other varieties of beastfolk exist here, such as rabbitfolk and birdfolk.

By aiding Claw and Albert's plan, Nimbus and the others were able to end the war between the catfolk and dogfolk. Their job complete, they headed to the next world.

1:
Refers to the liquid energy source that Claw learned about in Starview Village.

Believing that prosperity was needed in order to forget the past and walk towards the future, Claw began Project: Burny Gloop, a collaborative effort between the catfolk and dogfolk to excavate the fuel source.

Due to the long war between the catfolk and dogfolk, the infrastructure of both societies was in tatters. From refugees suffering in poverty to soldiers suddenly out of work resorting to banditry and terrorism, a number of issues popped up after the war was over. Claw and Albert have had their paws full dealing with these problems.
2: In order to help Albert and Claw, Alk began introducing the two to various leaders from other worlds, giving them more experiences to draw from. One such interaction inspired them to create a military group to develop the borderlands in order to give the former dogfolk soldiers a new purpose.

1: A race of beastfolk with power and numbers rivaling the catfolk. Ruled by a monarchy, the centralization of power in their society far surpasses the catfolk.
2: In the past, the catfolk presided over Fang Canyon as Archons, but when their Oracle's Hall stopped receiving decrees, their power waned. That was when the dogfolk—skilled in working as groups—began to learn metallurgy, and the military prowess they gained through this technology put them on top.
3: After the peace treaty was signed, many dogfolk soldiers found themselves out of work and treated like outcasts in their own homes. These soldiers now resent the peace that caused their ostracization and have been causing trouble for the incoming catfolk population. Their growing numbers are the cause of many headaches for Albert.

1: A race of beastfolk with power and numbers rivaling the dogfolk. In the past, they were ruled by the Whitetail family, who presided over all beastfolk in Fang Canyon.
2: Unlike the dogfolk, the catfolk are not ruled by a centralized government, instead being made up of different clans. However, at one time, the Whitetail family presided over the clans as spiritual leaders. Claudius Navelle now acts as the chief of the catfolk.
3: Since the peace treaty, the catfolk, particularly the younger generation, have strengthened their relationships with the dogfolk. However, the older generation is more resistant, not fully trusting the dogfolk. Even with mutually beneficial projects, it's not uncommon for catfolk to bristle at the idea of working with dogfolk, giving the new chief Claw a headache.

1:
With their supernatural authority and oppressive strength, the Whitetail family stood not only as leaders of the catfolk, but of all the beastfolk in Fang Canyon. They went by many names, from Masters of the Roaring Fangs to Archon.

Beneath their graveyard lies the sanctum where the World Flipper resides.
2:
According to legend, the Whitetails were godkings whose knowledge brought prosperity to the catfolk. From this, it can be assumed that the Whitetail leaders would receive oracles from the World Flipper, which they then spread to the world.

This legend is depicted on the walls of the Oracle's Hall in the sanctum.

1: A best-selling book in Fang Canyon that records the adventures of Nimbus, although ever so slightly embellished. Edited by Claudius Navelle.

The wolffolk king ruling over the dogfolk. Previously a commanding presence, the long, fruitless war with the catfolk has shaken the dogfolk's faith in him. He opposed peace with the catfolk to the bitter end, but he was powerless to stop the coup that ended the war. His authority has been passed on to Albert.
イヌトネコノセンソウ

The conflict waged between the catfolk and dogfolk of Fang Canyon has raged for ages. In the beginning, it was simple territorial disputes, but as technology advanced, the violence escalated. After dogfolk radicals murdered the catfolk ruler King Whitetail, the catfolk morale was severely wounded, and their forces weakened. Fortunately, the younger generation was able to broker peace and end the conflict.

Leader of the catfolk village and Claw's grandfather.

Despite being a warrior of lower class, he was tasked with protecting Prince Selenius. The fact that he was unable to fulfill his duty is his deepest regret.

Final resting place of the rulers in the Whitetail lineage. When the catfolk and dogfolk were negotiating peace, radical dogfolk attacked the king, who hid inside the sanctum that once stood in the graveyard. The assassins set fire to the sanctum, burning the king and his son alive.

Deep within the sanctum lies the World Flipper.
The sole heir to King Whitetail, killed alongside his father. An emotional child who cared deeply for his pantherfolk protector.

A world completely covered in metal, down to the earth itself./n
/n
When the sirens alerted the citizens of another emergency, a lone girl headed towards the light she saw fall from the sky.
2:
No organic life-forms exist on the Android Planet. Instead, the world is populated by human-like androids and soulless robots. It is likely the androids will leave a mark on history as a new form of civilization.

Having defeated the Administrator—the last remnant of humanity on this planet—Alk and the others headed to the next world.
3:
After the Administrator's death, two factions formed on the Android Planet. They are:

The Defaulters, who wish to continue on the Administrator's work and are resistant to change.

The Updaters, a rebel group hoping to change society.

Conflict between the groups grows more violent with each passing day.

1: A new type of person that occupies the Android Planet. While their artificial bodies and intelligence classify them as androids, they do possess the ability to follow their figurative hearts, making them no different from humans in this respect.
2: The androids are designed to mimic humans, right down to their imperfect nature and desire to pass on their legacy to a new generation. In order to achieve this, limitations were put in place during their creation to prevent them from being influenced and altered by outside factors. The result is an imperfect existence full of joy and sorrow, birth and death.
3:
Similar to how mankind will supplement their physical limitations with tools, the androids also regularly modify or update parts of themselves. Knowledge of what exactly constitutes the android's true self is likely lost in the Administrator's forgotten past.

An android's sound synthesizer, or their voice, is considered sacred, and altering it is strictly prohibited.

1: The ruler of the Android Planet. In order to create a new civilization from the ashes of the old, she created the androids.
2:
The minds of multiple humans make up the Administrator's conscience./n
/n
After the first extinction, the survivors quickly realized they lacked the resources to survive, so they moved their consciences into a machine. Unfortunately, due to the limited storage, they had to consolidate their memories into one identity, becoming the Administrator.
3:
"Music will bring us closer to humans."

Seeking companionship, the Administrator created the androids from pieces of herself. Back then, her heart was filled with love and joy.

However, her mind grew old as the years wore on. What remained was but a shell of her former self, obsessed with wiping the memories and hearts of those she once held dear.

1: Generally refers to a system error. On the Android Planet, it is a slang term used to describe the malfunctioning robots roaming around aimlessly.
2: Unlike androids, robots do not possess artificial intelligence and perform actions based on orders received from the network. According to Regis, bugs are created in the network from the wiped memories of androids.

1:
Refers to the memories of androids that have been wiped and discarded.

Hollows are androids that recognize that there is a hole in their memories. They then grow belligerent and roam the streets in search of memory bytes to replace the ones they lost.
キオクセンジョウシャ
Androids who have had their memories wiped or reset by the Administrator. A common punishment for androids that rebelled or otherwise stepped out of line.

A term the Administrator mentions after recognizing Stella as "the Watcher."

Upon realizing the "Purgers" were not present, the Administrator seemed relieved and resolved to kill Stella and the others.
2: The ancient dragon Rustamov used this term when referring to the Champions. It appears dragons exist to increase the power of these Purgers.

1: A young man who appeared in a vision Stella had while retrieving the coordinates in the android world. Light, who saw the same vision, mentioned that Lux is the name of a legendary Champion on his world. This vision strengthened the group's theory that Stella is connected to the Champions.
2:
The Champion Lux was but another Purger used by the Goddess of the Stars. He slayed dragons, ravaged the stars, and destroyed worlds, but not in the name of justice. Over time, he grew to resent and pity Stella.

He begged Stella to end his suffering, but his whereabouts after this point are lost to time.

1: Unlike androids, robots are only capable of performing pre-determined tasks. The number of bugs, or malfunctioning robots, has been steadily increasing.

A district found deep below the metal metropolis. While the world above was being rebuilt after the first extinction, this area was filled with workers' huts and abuzz with activity. However, once the city above was finished, it was abandoned. Nowadays it's home to bugs and hollows.
One of the first androids created. Alpha once sang for the Administrator to ease her loneliness.
One of the first androids created. Beta would often ask the Administrator to sing.

These stark-white halls house the Administrator's true body.

With the Administrator now dead, Regis has decorated the area with white flowers, making the area her grave.
A world where the buildings are made with distinctive tiled roofs. When Alk and friends first arrived, they found themselves in the middle of a battle between a fox-eared woman and a young diviner.
2:
Five years ago, a great earthquake shook Yamato. The East and the West, both connected to the world of yokai, had their lands joined together. After undoing the seal of Orochi, Suizen further intertwined the worlds, but it was all in an effort to foil the Masked Sorceress' plans.

Opening the way to another world, Alk and friends then continued their journey.

1: The organization that Suizen serves as the chairman of. Originally from the West, the Commission is comprised of skilled magic users utilizing techniques long lost the East. The shogun, ruler of the East, entrusts the country's safety to them.
2:
When the Commission operated under the West's ruler, it held significant political power. However, after the merging of the West and the East, it has simply become one party of many.

Without the support of the shogun, the Commission would have most likely been dissolved. As it stands, allowing the young Suizen to lead the organization was one emergency measure of several to ensure the Commission's continued existence.

1: ハクメンコンモウキュウビノキツネ

A powerful yokai once feared in the West. Legends claim that her tails shined like a comet soaring through the night, and with a simple flick of them, she brought about calamity. She is also Inaho's mother.
The three fox kits who follow Inaho and can take the forms of other beings. Their names are Awa, Hie, and Mugi, and they can be told apart by the symbols on their foreheads.

An eight-headed malevolent monster. Hundreds of thousands of souls from the East were sealed into this manifestation of the formidable yokai, giving it the power to regenerate as long as it had souls to sacrifice.

Alk and friends were finally able to defeat it after Suizen used his Circle of Growth to destroy the seal and release the souls back into the land.
2:
The East and the West seem to share similar histories and legends, so it should come as no surprise that Orochi is a central figure in the creation myths of both places.

The manifestation of Orochi that was summoned by the Masked Sorceress contained the souls of yokai and sacred beings from the East. Suizen requested that Alk and friends keep this particular piece of information to themselves.

1: Drifters in Yamato are called marebito by some diviners. They're known to use the World Flipper to travel to other worlds.

The country that is ruled by the shogun and forms the main part of Yamato. Its people live in tenement-style homes, and its craftsmen are always developing new technology and honing their skills. Of particular popularity are its artists and their manga—stories told through pictures and text. Any visitors should make sure to stop by the East's many fireworks festivals and mountainside teahouses.

Another version of Yamato that suddenly appeared five years ago. Only parts of its land came over and merged with the East, bringing with it varied people and strange phenomena. Crossing its fogs takes visitors to strange villages, while traversing its roads at night might mysteriously whisk a traveler to faraway lands. Yokai have free roam of the West, and in general, the people there adhere to a more traditional culture in comparison to the East.

An organization of ninjas that operates in the shadows to carry out the shogun's will. The majority of their work is comprised of distasteful tasks, but in times of peace, their delicate touch is not needed.

Currently, the Diviners' Commission has taken the place of the country's shinobi, which is why they've drawn the ninjas' ire.

The harsh and restricting life of a ninja results in quite a number of ninja running away from their home village.

A mystical shrine where the sakura trees bloom all year round. The bamboo-shrouded stairway leading up to it stretches on for quite a ways—about long enough to equal two mountains of length. The divine grounds of the shrine are home to the golden fox, She of Nine Tails.
A world covered in glistening snow. Despite appearances, it is Light's home world, as well as the Home of the Champions.
2:
The royal line of Stratos reigned over this world, where legends of the Champions were passed down through generations. However, when Light disappeared fifty years prior, many worlds merged together with this one, causing abundant blizzards and allowing Pandemonium to slowly eat away at the world.

In an effort to escape the Lord of Shadow, Alk and company fled this world and traveled to a new one.

1:
An elderly warrior with red hair and an eyepatch. As a powerful witch, she once fought the Lord of Shadow at Light's side. She continued to struggle against the Lord's forces even after Light vanished fifty years ago.

Known as the Witch of Burning Blood, humanity's strongest warrior uses her blood to scorch her foes and turn them to ash.
2:
She led the Resistance while raising Lilith, last of the royal bloodline, from the tender age of four.

To buy time for Alk and the others to escape, she bid Lilith her final farewell and sacrificed her life in a fight against Oghir, Lord of Shadow.
3:
She and Light were childhood friends from the same village. When sixteen-year-old Light left on a journey, six-year-old Shakari could only cry as he departed.

Ten years later, when Light returned home, Shakari showed off the magical abilities she had honed and asked to join him on his next journey. Light initially refused, but Light's mother convinced him to let Shakari join.
4: Shakari developed a romantic relationship with the cleric Joshua while she journeyed with Light. Oblivious as ever, Light had no idea she had begun seeing Joshua, just as he had no inkling of the other thoughts and feelings Shakari never shared with him. Only Lilith, Shakari's daughter, knows the various things she never said to him.

1:
Once the princess of the Stratos royal family and the object of Light's admiration, she was also Lilith's grandmother.

After losing her father, her country, and her child, the only saving grace throughout her lifetime of suffering was the odd companionship she shared with Shakari.

A fiend man with dead, sunken-in eyes and violent tendencies worsened by emotional instability. Revealed to be a daemon when he revived himself after Shakari burned him alive. He also showed that he could turn others into daemons as well.
2:
Before Oghir found him, he was to be executed for the crime of murdering his parents. He let himself be swept into the darkness of his Lord's embrace, believing in the salvation he offered.

The vestiges of pain in his eyes left a lasting impression on Alk.

"You and I share the same resentment and hatred for these miserable fools. Let's make that dream a reality!"

1: Enormous lances embedded within the ground. The pierced land connects the Home of the Champions to Pandemonium.

An ancient dragon. Also known as the Golden One. Even among ancient dragons, he was the oldest.

He spent many years waiting in the Silver Woods for the Champion, but when he finally laid eyes on Light and Stella, he realized their vessels were broken. With his physical form failing him, Rustamov left his Mark behind and passed on.
2:
The day that Light disappeared, the ancient dragons took to the heavens and attempted to follow the Champion through a dimensional tear that Rams Euphoria created. The Dark Throne's forces attacked relentlessly, grievously wounding Rustamov, who was in the rear guard, and preventing him from following the other dragons.

Afterwards, the elves arrived as worlds merged. In exchange for maintaining the barrier that protected them, Rustamov was allowed to hide in their forest.
3: Out of the many, many years of his life, Rustamov regarded the time he spent with Estariel, princess of the high elves, most fondly. Though he questioned his fate numerous times, his final wish was for a future for her.
4:
After the battle with the Lord of Shadow concluded, the Mark containing the holy dragon's soul crumbled into pieces. The soul, long bound to the forest, finally returned to the star.

Upon returning to the star, the dragon lost all memories of his previous life. In the process of once more ascending the world, he met with a kindred soul also on his way to new life, ready to fulfill a promise with a friend.

1: Powerful immortal beings that hail from the Home of the Champions. Light is familiar with them, as they have appeared quite often in the legends of Champions.
2: Ancient dragons different from normal ones in that they cannot have offspring nor will they fully die—they will always revive to take on a similar form as before. The cost of a revival is all their memories. As such, to ancient dragons, it is as good as dying regardless.
3:
After an ancient dragon dies, they leave behind their Mark, which serves as a crystallized form of power. This Mark is key to unleashing a Champion's true power and granting them great strength. Taken another way, dragons are fodder for Champions.

Many dragons over time have rebelled against this fate. However, all of them fulfilled their role as fodder for Champions in the end.
4:
Ancient dragons have the power to travel across different stars. They can do this even alone, at the expense of greatly taxing themselves.

Even distant descendants of dragons and serpents, their sworn enemies, possess some measure of this power. With enough of their blood gathered through a secret technique, the Star Augurs are able to travel to different worlds.

1:
A crystallized form of power left behind by an ancient dragon that passed away. Considered the soul of a dragon, it also serves as power source for Champions.

Normally, only a Champion can absorb power from a Mark. In Estariel's case, she was able to stabilize and turn Rustamov's into a huge pool of mana, as he had spent a long time dispersing his power throughout the Silver Woods.
2: The Mark of Rustamov was never intended to be used as a source of mana. Light's desire to fight is what forced the Mark to grant him power, which differs greatly from the souless Purgers who only follow orders.

1: A cleric who once joined Light on his mission to defeat the Lord of Shadow. Even when Light vanished, he held onto the belief that their Champion would one day return. He passed away before he could see that day.
2:
He was romantically involved with Shakari and remained her steadfast companion in their fight against the Lord of Shadow after Light disappeared.

Though their time together did not last more than ten years, Shakari was grateful for what time they did have.

1: A revolutionary army comprised of various peoples and led by Princess Lilith, descendant of the Stratos Royal Family. Their goal—to overthrow the Dark Throne and save whoever they can.

A lively, refugee boy who took a liking to Alk and befriended him.

After his mother was struck down in front of him, he went missing after the meteor shower the Lord of Shadow summoned.
2: Among the remaining refugees that Estariel's people were able to rescue, Eric was discovered walking alongside Marly.
3:
While Alk and Lilith were distributing food, they ran into Marly and Eric once more. Alk was so relieved to see Eric unharmed that he burst into tears.

With Eric entering Marly's care, he has gained himself two new sisters.

1:
For many years, the royal line of Stratos ruled over the Home of the Champions. Fifty years prior, the royal kingdom fell when Light lost to the Dark Throne, and Doomsday Lances and Pandemonium began to encroach on the world. The king perished, but Princess Lily was able to escape in the chaos following the elven world joining theirs.

The fate of the royal family now falls on its sole surviving member: Lilith Stratos, granddaughter of Princess Lily.
2:
Beneath Castle Excelion lies the Oracle's Hall, a room known only to royal lineage. It is where the birth of the next champion is foretold.

However, when it came time for the champion Light to be born, there was no prophecy—only marks in the ground where the World Flipper had been stolen from.
3:
The line of Stratos was chosen by the Overlords and the Goddess of the Stars to be Archons and watch over their world. Their main role was to guide the Champions and maintain their world as a lid over Pandemonium, keeping the abyss at bay.

They were referred to as heirs of the Starlit Throne.

1: A blue-skinned race of people with horns and wings. They are the sworn enemies of the people living in the Home of the Champions.
2: Like many other races, their people struggle to survive, especially steeped in the curses and poisons of their infertile land. Plagued by a severe lack of resources, they fight without caring what it is they face—all in an effort to survive. Most are conscripted into the army and, given a lack of alternatives, accept their fate. Families are provided monetary compensation for any children that are conscripted.
4:
When the fiends were first banished to Pandemonium, their people looked the same as those of any other world.

They received their current appearance when the dark dragon Armadeus rebelled against the heavens and left them with his remains.

1:
The hidden forest where the elves live. Blanketed in tranquility and beauty, it almost seems like time doesn't pass there.

It is also known as the Shifting Woods, for the barrier erected around it holds the power to force any unwelcome visitors to wander back to the same point, over and over again.
Her true form is that of Estariel. She took on the guise of a naive girl and allowed herself to be attacked, all in order to discern the true nature of Alk and his companions.

High elves possess an indefinite lifespan and were given the name "high elf" to distinguish them from the elves who are born with mortal lives.

It is believed that the high elves, in despair from the ever-increasing number of mortal elves, put themselves to sleep and left only Estariel behind in their place.
2:
The first elves were created beneath the sky of Starview Village by the Goddess of the Stars. With a set way of thinking and the ability to live forever, the elves resembled the goddess in a way. However, no one knows why she created them in the first place.

The Champion Lumiere was present at the elves' creation. She sang a song of blessings that the elves, even now, remember.

1: These elven-made magical cloaks, when worn from head to toe, turn their wearers invisible. Estariel lent some to Adjudicus at one point.

A trial to test the legitimacy of a Champion who appears without a prophecy.

As the trial was not necessary for quite a long time, the cleric in charge couldn't remember the exact details for Light's trial.
While these sweets look tantalizing, they taste even better than they look—magically so. Filling and packed with nutrients, they also warm the body from the inside out.

As revealed by the other Stella, the Lord's true name is Oghir.

Bearing a blade that looked exactly like Alk's, Oghir unleashed his own Meteor Break and called down a meteor shower, easily defeating Alk and company. Only Shakari, by sacrificing her life, was able to stop him in his tracks.
2:
Twisted by the spirits of the dead, his true form is steeped in the curse. He is the Lord of Daemons.

With the help of the other Stella, his powers rival that of a Champion's, and his body is immortal like all other daemons.
3:
The secret to his immortality lies in the Abyss within Pandemonium. Through it, the vestiges of lost souls in the world of the dead bequeaths unlimited power to Oghir in the form of the curse.

To Oghir, salvation awaited only by tainting everything with the curse.
4:
Before he ascended the Dark Throne, Oghir was a fiend man, thin from his dedication to academic pursuits. Adjudicus was his nephew.

Though he sought to save the world through unsightly means, in the end, he was taken with the beauty that remained in it.

1: シャクティノテリョウリ

Game meat wrapped in a large leaf, covered in honey, and roasted next to a fire. The leaf seasons the meat with spice and gets rid of any odor.

Shakari devised this sweet and spicy treat as a way to get Lilith, a picky eater, to eat.

A barren land enveloped in darkness, where the Overlords banished their enemies to. Otherwise known as Pandemonium.

Waking up in Pandemonium, an injured Alk was forced to cooperate with Adjudicus in order to reunite with Stella and the others.
2:
The Overlords feared Pandemonium's connection to the abyss, the gateway to the underworld, and cut it off from the other worlds. They then established the Home of the Champions as a lid to shut Pandemonium in, observe it, and keep it under control.

After repelling the Purgers that appeared from the realm of the Overlords, Alk and company steeled themselves for the conflict ahead and returned to Starview Village.

1:
A fiend woman with long white hair and horns. She sheltered Lilith and Stella from danger, as they reminded her of her two daughters who were both conscripted into the Lord of Shadow's army. Ilbis intended to punish her for this by turning her into a daemon, but she was lucky enough to avoid such a fate.

After the formation of the alliance, Marly took Eric into her care.

An enormous lance. It is the central point that connects to all Doomsday Lances on the surface.

The spire also leads all the way to the abyss.
The lance that served as the core of the Doomsday Spire. Aside from being able to control all the Doomsday Lances, this tool is also connected to the world of the dead.
2:
Originally, the Antipode Lance belonged to the Goddess of the Stars. It allowed her to both establish her authority and pierce through worlds, combining or detaching realms as she saw fit.

In Stella's hands, it allows her to draw out the full potential of her current powers.

1: The name of the people who created Stella and the Champion. Their true identity is as of yet unknown.
2:
Once upon a time, a large war broke out between worlds. It is said that the Overlords put an end to it and subjugated them all, creating the Goddess of the Stars and the Purgers in the process.

According to Nova, Alk and company will require the Antipode Lance to infiltrate the realm of the Overlords, where they have been hiding away.

1:
A sword that was in Alk's possession when he arrived in Starview Village, though he has no memory of how he came to have it.

Oghir, Lord of Shadows, possesses the same sword and revealed its name to Alk.
2:
With the ability to destroy worlds, the Starbreaker was originally the most powerful of the Star Relics—one that the Goddess of Stars would bestow upon the Champion.

This sword of destruction brought down the stars upon countless worlds. When the Goddess of Stars split in two, the Starbreaker did the same, as if in response.

1: In the high elven language, it means "an ancient Star Immemorial." It most likely refers to the worlds hovering in the sky above Starview Village.
2: The first elves awoke in Starview Village. The first stars they laid eyes on were the worlds floating above Starview Village. Later on, the elves would revere the stars they could see from their own world, but the high elves knew—none of them would ever match an ancient Star Immemorial.

1:
Brandishing the same powers as the Champions, these winged automatic apparatuses are in charge of purging worlds.

While the Purger, brandisher of the blade, was meant to be the strongest of the strong, the winged Purgers overwhelm their enemies through sheer numbers. Their design is meant to instill fear in any who dare cross them.
A person revolting against the Overlords. He claims to be another broken Stella. He worked with Stella to close the abyss.

The name that Oghir gave the other Stella. Now she is the one who carries on his legacy.

When the Goddess Stella cleansed herself, this half of her person is the one she discarded.
The rebel army fighting against the Lord of Shadow. Adjudicus serves as their leader.
One of many Champions. She sang when the elves were created.
One of many Champions. He kept a journal of his adventures.
2:
Curiously, within the pages of the legends of the Champions, there is one Champion whose name was never recorded.

He went on to become the writer known as Amorous Clarence, who was famous for his romance stories. His literature found great popularity, especially among children.

1:
Deep below the Doomsday Spire is a hole gouged into the world. It leads into the depths of the underworld.

The Dark Throne draws its power and immortality from this place. The World Flipper that was once in Castle Excelion now finds its home here as well.

Pandemonium was exiled to cut the Abyss off from the remaining worlds.
2:
The Abyss connects to another world beyond the seven realms—one that neither the Goddess of Stars or Overlords fully understand.

The Overlords, fearing this unknown place that blurred the lines between life and death and defied the known laws of the universe, wished to keep it from affecting their worlds.
3:
The more worlds that are connected, the heavier their load. They begin to draw in other worlds, creating a cascading effect until the burden grows too much to bear and the collective mass begins to break apart.

The singularity that forms is known as the Abyss. The Abyss in Pandemonium formed from the same phenomenon.

Stella and the others were manipulated into creating such a cascading effect through their journey across worlds.
4:
Pandemonium's Abyss has reached its limit. One day soon, both Pandemonium and the Home of the Champions will be consumed by it.

The timing of the Kaleidoscope's formation coincided with the changes in the Home of the Champions. This fact, combined with the many visitors appearing from other worlds, means that the Kaleidoscope is already connected to the Abyss and approaching an unstable mass.

1:
Lord Oghir after he merged with multiple daemons. He became the last bastion of those who chose to drown in the darkness.

Though he'd already lost his immortality and was ready to vanish into the light, he still chose to hold onto the weak.

What Stella was known as when she still functioned as a goddess.

Records of her remain in the many worlds she watched over, including the oracles that she left behind.

A world containing the Kaleidoscope, which is connected to other worlds. Unfortunately, the Kaleidoscope is also connected to the Abyss, making it a target of the Purgers.

In order to gain information about the Goddess of the Stars and the Overlords, Alk and friends paid a visit to the Sheephirds.
2:
To the west lies the large kingdom of the Farlands. Palpebra, the city centered around the Kaleidoscope, has become Alk and friends' second home.

Knowing that the Kaleidoscope is connected to the Abyss, Alk and friends prepared their new comrades for the inevitable day that the Purgers would come knocking.

1: レンサユウゴウゲンショウ
Worlds that merge grow heavier in mass and draw in other worlds. The Abyss appearing is a sign that a world's weight is nearing critical mass.
A nomadic people that live on the outskirts of Palpebra. Adult Sheephirds look like children to other people, and they are often treated accordingly, much to their chagrin.
2: According to Sheephird legend, their ancestor came upon people who appeared out of nowhere in the Land of Beginnings and brought them to the Farlands. This person became known as the Guide, and his people became known as the Sheephirds for the sheep they herded to sustain everyone on their journey to the Farlands.

1: A Sheephird term for humans, the prominent race of people in the world of the Shifting City. They were named such for the great distance they crossed on foot, from the Field of Sorrow to the Farlands.

The chief of the Sheephirds. Unlike the rest of her nomadic people who prefer simple lives, she rose to the upper ranks of the Guild. Extremely rational and always with her defenses up, she may appear cold to others. But everything she does is for the safety and prosperity of Palpebra, as well as to support Pur Lilie in her efforts to aid adventurers.

A race of people with a small population, living on the outskirts of Palpebra. Not many people have seen their distinctive thick coats of fur, as they normally keep to themselves.

Beastfolk drifters are often mistaken for gargans, but they are in fact completely different races.

A tribe of beastfolk that occupied a village outside Palpebra. They came from the Home of the Champions and drifted to outside Palpebra, likely by fault of their world merging with others.

With their Spirit Horns, they are able to communicate without words. Due to this, their spoken language might sound stilted to others.
2: In actuality, their tribe was first transported to the Rift, not Palpebra. The Purgers that followed them slaughtered many of their people, and the survivors struggled to devise a way to escape with their lives.
3:
The Vesta were not originally from the Home of the Champions. Much like the elves, their world merged there.

The Vesta and other beastfolk were used by humans in their fight against the fiends. The humans' abhorrent treatment of them taught the Vesta to be wary of all strangers outside their tribe.
4:
Reading a person's Oudo via one's Spirit Horns holds various levels of significance for the Vesta.

That being said, none of them were quite prepared for how much their leader Memram changed after taking in the Oudo of the strangers that aided them.

1: Paths that split from the Kaleidoscope and lead to the surface. In an effort to prevent smuggling, these paths are both kept secret and heavily surveilled.

A region that exists between worlds.

Whenever a shift occurs, people are sometimes transported into this space. The entire Vesta tribe became trapped in the Rift after they were taken there.

Instruments that are capable of opening a space to connect worlds. Only authorized users can draw out their true power.

The dagger that Nova gave Memram and Alk's Starbreaker are both Star Relics.

Members of a bloodline that the Goddess of Stars entrusted with watching over their world. The Whitetails of Fang Canyon are one such line of Archons.

In most cases, Archons are granted access to exclusive powers and information in order to carry out their duty effectively.
The title Memram gave Nimbus after seeing him among the group of heroes that saved the Home of the Champions.
The title Memram gave to Alk because of the filling soup he made for the refugees. Later on, she amended his title to Hero of the Red Soup, out of affection and respect.

A word in the language of the Vesta that refers to psychic energy. By reading one another's Oudo, the Vesta are able to communicate without words. They can read the feelings of other people as well, but by manipulating one's emotions, a person can deceive the Vesta.

Much like communicating through words or touch, there are different subtleties to reading Oudo that carry various connotations.
シュウキョクノシゲン
Alk and friends dove into a gate, traveling to a world within the Rift. What they found there filled Alk with a strange sense of nostalgia.
2:
The isolated city of Shibuya was cut off from the world over 10,000 years ago. Its existence was preserved through the way its citizens perceived their reality.

When Shibuya's citizens were awoken from the dream and started disappearing into the Rift, Stella raised her lance into the air and joined Shibuya with Palpebra.

1: セイヤノオサワガセモノ
Visiting Palpebra during the holidays, the party took on a quest to clear out the snow golems that ruined the festivities.
2:
Challua wished the golems a happy holiday, before they vanish. It appeared that they just wanted presents like the rest of Palpebra's residents.

The star-shaped ornaments are in Stella's care now.

1:
One of Palpebra's festivals, also known as the Holiday Festival. A legendary individual known as Santa Claus is said to give presents to children on this day, while families eat cake together and parents give presents to their children.

According to legend, Santa Claus is said to be related to the Sheephirds.
After the mountain of presents for the Holiday Festival were stolen by Snow Golems, Pur Lilie arranged this event in a hurry. She insisted she planned it all along.
シンシュンオトシフリッパー
Alk and his companions visited Yamato for the New Year's. There, they met Mal Lelucia and got roped into a mock battle with a magic-powered, party-ready sparring machine!
2: Alk triumphed over the Kadomatsu S.S., and the machine exploded into a shower of rice cakes, which were consumed by gleeful lookers-on. A pleased Lelucia promised another year of exciting shenanigans, much to the consternation of Alk and Light.

1: カドマツゴウセイゴウ

A magic-powered, party-ready sparring machine prepared by Mal Lelucia at the request of merchants looking for a way to attract customers.

It walks, it talks, and it's a glowy block. It even has combat capabilities to ward off bad luck.
Valentine's Fest: All's Fair in Love and War
ソウゼツヴァレントフェスコウボウセン
Pur Lilie tasked the party with helping Monster Chef Parfait gather ingredients, while also keeping an eye on her.
2:
Parfait created a giant chocolate Phoenix with the help of Alk and the others, but accidentally fitted it with golem cores. 

Despite things kicking off with a fight against an animated chocolate monstrosity, Valentine's Fest ended up being a wild success.

1: One of Palpebra's festivals, where people get together and eat sweets. It seems to lack any customs regarding giving sweets to someone you're fond of.
2:
After talking with Alk, Ellya started propagating the idea of giving sweets as a way of confessing love, and the idea spread quickly.

The idea of chocolate given as an obligation also spread, much to the delight of Palpebra's merchants.

1:
Dishes made up of materials from monsters. While they appear grotesque, the chef Parfait saw potential in this form of cooking, and with great skill creates strange but delicious dishes.

The residents of Starview Village seem wary of whether this style of cuisine will make its way into Alk's Cooking.
コウサイノマテンロウ

Qualia City: a place where soaring skyscrapers and video advertisements fill the skies.

Soon after Alk and co. arrived here they were rescued by Bulleta, who was assisted by her partner Love. Bulleta then took them to her hideout.
2:
This city is ruled by two competing, titanic corporations named AltMeme and Noxel. Bionics, machine-enhanced people, and synthetics, human-like machines, roam its streets. In a place governed by corporate ethos, even memories and feelings are sold as commodities.

After meeting Alk and the others, Bulleta pierced a hole through the man-made sky with her light.

1:
The dome that covers Qualia City not only shields it from the real sky above, but also displays never-ending holographic advertisements.

Bulleta wanted, more than anything else, to show Love what the real sky looked like on the other side.

Full name: Paradigm Break Company. This chemical manufacturer is a prominent subsidiary of AltMeme and is defined by its innovative corporate ethos. Noxel Group is seen as its rival.

Their company color is blue.

The newer of the two major corporations ruling this world. While it strives to maintain law and order through its services without being bound by outdated conventions, its innovative approach sometimes creates problems.

They are currently trying to gather as much information as they can on the World Flipper.

One of the two major corporations ruling this world. It has held control over Qualia City and its World Flipper for a long time. The services of law and order that it provides are more traditional in nature, and many of its higher-ups are elderly, conservative organics that refuse to receive modifications.

Top brass at DayAndNight, a major subsidiary of Noxel Group. Acting in line with the Myriad Project, he worked for Mother Love. After she stepped down as head of DAN, however, control of the company fell to him.

Individuals without bionic modifications are known as organics and are a minority in Qualia City. Not obvious at a glance, they modify their bodies through more expensive and subtle means such as nanotech immunization and genome enhancements, so being an organic is a privilege reserved for the elite.

Found in the slums of Qualia City, these monsters are as smelly as they are dangerous and will gobble up any unsuspecting victims that cross their paths. The Conductor and Bulleta both confused Light for a mutant when they first met.

The handymen of Qualia City. When sufficient compensation is offered, troubleshooters will take on requests from both Noxel Group and AltMeme. Bulleta and Love are both troubleshooters, and King Johnson also claims to have once been one.
Synthetics are autonomous, humanoid robots, or androids. They are tools with artificial intelligence developed for a specific purpose or task, and are not equipped with human-like intelligence.

Individuals with mechanical modifications replacing some degree of their organic bodies (in other words, cyborgs) are known as bionics. They represent the majority of Qualia City's populace. Modifications range from more minor adjustments like a prosthetic hand to such drastic changes as a cyborganically advanced brain, and are available to individuals in proportion to their own financial means.
Everything is packaged and sold in Qualia City, even the air filtered to rooms. AltMeme is known for sending air that reeks of sewage to those who don't pay their bills.

Genome enhancements are used to increase one's natural abilities by manipulating their DNA. Even without utilizing the bionic enhancements typical of Qualia City's middle and lower classes, these advanced, expensive enhancements grant individuals access to superhuman abilities.

AdTaste allows the consumer to take any flavor advertised to them and add it to water or the otherwise tasteless, odorless SoyMate. Because it sends false signals to the brain regarding what is actually being consumed, it can be enjoyed even by unmodified individuals. It is especially popular among those who cannot afford natural foods.

The law is upheld in Qualia City via private companies in absence of an actual government. Because of the emphasis placed on strict cost efficiency, only the wealthier areas receive these services while the poorer ones grow increasingly dilapidated and deserted.

Full name: DayAndNight. As a major subsidiary of Noxel Group, it has its hand in various forms of business, ranging from munitions and logistics to daily household supplies. This also helps maintain the corporation's public image.

Their company color is white.
A synthetic working for DAN. Also a close associate of company president Mother Love and a subordinate of the Conductor.

CEO of PBC (Paradigm Break Company), an industry leader and subsidiary of AltMeme. An exceptional businessman, he constantly stirs the pot with his bombastic antics in order to bring about business opportunities.

He also spins a lot.
2: He commendably put a lot of effort into helping the hero Nate, but the incident with the Unification AI crashed PBC's stock prices and tanked his career. He was forced to start all over from a cramped, dirty office, but it seems that he is already well on his way to recovering what he lost.

1: An acronym meaning "as soon as possible." Bulleta and King Johnson are both fond of using it in conversation.

Hackers carry out intelligence operations via illegally accessing and intercepting data on Qualia City's network.

Love is a hacker herself—and an expert one at that.

A plan to maintain the status quo of Qualia City. It was developed by Noxel Group and assigned to Mother Love. The Conductor, Radius, and all of DAN's employees were nothing but tools used to ensure the plan's continued success.
イツワリノニンギョウヒメ

A request from the Adventurer's Guild brought the party to a certain forest. Within it they found a massive castle and town that shouldn't have been there.

They then encountered the prince Razelt and a mysterious robed man under attack.
2:
The castle in the forest had been built upon a mountain of lies.

The Poppet Princess Prika realized she'd been living out a fake life in a false story. But in pursuing the truth, she discovered a part of herself.

After joining hands with her newfound family, she set off with Alk and friends.

1:
Simon's father was Grey, a man who took care of the princess Prika in the heart of an unexplored forest. Grey spent a lifetime taking care of this abandoned weapon.

Afraid of falling to the same fate as his father, Simon prepared to eliminate Prika himself.
2: During their confrontation, Prika declared herself and Simon as siblings and cleared away Simon's ill will. After the two reconciled, Simon sent Prika off to journey with Alk and friends.

1:
The Kingdom of Mosnia once had powerful weapons at their disposal—people of a bloodline that could use creation magic. Through this magic, they could create entire castles and towns, and poppets to do their bidding.

Mosnia was able to hold its own against the Farlands through creation magic, but their ruin was brought about by infighting and the abuse of these powers.

As a descendant of this bloodline, Prika has access to the same creation magic.

An elderly servant that looked after Prika. He was also the father of Simon. As a descendant of a family that served the destroyed Mosnia, he took care of Prika, a blood relative of the abandoned weapons. He was moved by her innocence and gave her a false life as a princess. He died regretting this decision.

A state said to have existed not far from the forest. They constantly battled with the Farlands over territorial disputes without descending into full-scale war.

It was destroyed 300 years ago as a result of infighting and the abuse of creation magic.

The prince of Mosnia that Prika kept in contact with. The way he described Mosnia in his letters brought joy to Prika.

In reality the prince never existed, and all the letters were written by Grey.

Welcome to Paradise Isle: an artificial island floating in the Endless Blue. Instead of taking a relaxing vacation there, Marina set her eyes on the legendary pirate captain Zegra's lost treasure. Joined by Zegra's son, Luca, Marina and friends embarked on a new adventure.
2:
The only thing Captain Zegra left behind was a means to modify people, as well as an ugly obsession with his progeny and his archenemy.

After foiling the plot of the mysterious Star Augur, Marina bid goodbye to Luca before enjoying the rest of her vacation with Alk and Stella.

1:
A legendary pirate so infamous that all who sail the seas know his name.

Marina acknowledges that he was annoyingly strong, but she could not accept what he later became.
2:
One day, Zegra fell ill. He became a tyrant who sent his crew to their deaths in order to find a cure.

It was then that he came into contact with the mysterious organization known as the Star Augurs and joined them in their quest to transcend humanity.
3:
They found something far mightier than humanity deep in the ocean. However, Zegra betrayed the Star Augurs, cast aside his human shell, and hid himself at the bottom of the sea.

He would not part with his greatest treasure, save for the son whose name he did not know and the woman he saw as his equal.

1: A top-of-the-line and well-known resort built on an artificial island. Aside from its beaches and pools, it boasts a casino, salon, colosseum, cafes, restaurants, hotels, and various other recreational facilities.

The young son of legendary pirate captain Zegra. Having never met the man, he was uncertain how to feel about him.

One day, he heard news about the discovery of his father's treasure, and left home to discover the truth of the treasure he left behind.

He was instantly captivated by Marina, who used to work for his father, and developed a rivalry with Alk, who seemed to be about his age.

The true name of the objects that make up Zegra's treasure.

Three of these exist in total—one held by Marina, one given to Luca's mother, and one set up as a prize at the casino in order to lure in the other owners.

In reality, these items contain research left behind by Zegra—crystallized information about a means of transcending humanity.

The casino of Paradise Isle, whose motto is to provide opportunities for the ambitious who seize the moment.

At the back of the building, there is a massive slot machine called the Money Muncher that is the shining symbol of the casino.

A hidden treasure rumored to have been left behind by the great pirate captain Zegra.

Pirates and salvagers have searched everywhere for it, hoping for great fortune. In reality, the treasure was not in the form of gold or silver, but rather research information from the captain and Adala regarding the power to alter mortal life.

A product of Zegra's research, this monster was created by crossing Zegra's mutated DNA with a dragon.

Alk and the others encountered this creature during their casino heist. It seemed to be under some level of control.

A Star Augur and researcher. She conducted research alongside the diseased Zegra to transcend humanity. She attempted to use Luca, who inherited his father's DNA, to bolster her research. Likely due to Luca's other genes, however, her experiment failed, and in the end she disappeared at the hands of an enraged Belsidia.
エレメントグレネード
A weapon that houses elemental energy. Removing the pin causes a violent elemental reaction, resulting in a bright flash of light.

A shadowy organization with a presence on many worlds. Like Alk and the others, they seem to have a means of hopping between worlds.

Their basic philosophy is focused entirely on transcending humanity. As such, the members of this organization will commit any atrocity necessary to reach their goals.
2:
The priests who were in charge of the small citadel in the misty mountains where Phiria and Cecilia once lived called themselves the Star Augurs. They gathered up children and attempted to cultivate powers within them. Phiria gained her powers in such a way.

Arum was treated similarly, which was proof enough that the Star Augurs cared little for both humans and fiends.
3:
The first time Phiria and Cecilia left the citadel, it was to ascend the battlefield in the Home of the Champions. It was then that they first learned of the existence of elves, beastfolk, fiends and daemons.

Despite the investigations that Lilith conducted, the citadel that these two called home has yet to be found.

1: The Yokai Encyclopedia: The Art of Change
ヨウカイズカンヘンサンキ
Suizen asked Alk and co. to join Kugui in her quest to edit the second volume of the Yokai Encyclopedia.
2:
Alk and co. were dragged into the competition that Gramp Zigza set up between Kugui and Ryouki. Though Kugui was initially hesitant because she couldn't control her powers, Ryouki gave her the encouragement she needed, and a battle between artists of the East and West began.

Everyone aided Kugui in defeating the shikigami that had been haunting her. With all said and done, Kugui and Ryouki started to work on the encyclopedia in earnest.

1:
A reference guide filled with pictures that Inaho and Gramp Zigza created together. It is meant to give humans an introduction to all manner of yokai.

Distributed during the holidays, it was an instant hit with both humans and yokai.
2:
With Gramp Zigza's portrayal of yokai being too close to reality, a curse sprung forth, twisting yokai's natures from the fears of the readers. The popularity of the encyclopedia only exacerbated the issue.

In an effort to prevent further problems, Suizen bade Kugui to edit the next volume, but her efforts only increased the quality and popularity of the encyclopedia.

1: ガキョウロウジンジグザ

A famous artist from Yamato. He has devoted his life to art and will draw anything he is interested in. On the other hand, he is extremely stubborn and refuses to draw anything that hasn't caught his eye.

He is the artist of the manga Koizora☆Azuki Style: An Illustrated Tale of Forbidden Romance, or KoiAzu for short.

The shortened name of the manga Koizora☆Azuki Style: An Illustrated Tale of Forbidden Romance.
